private_information: I am allowed to move disks A B C D E F G H
Disk labels A through O exist where A is the smallest and O is the largest
Initial stack on left peg from top to bottom is A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O
agent_1.goal: Achieve the specified goal configuration using legal Tower of Hanoi moves while only moving disks A B C D E F G H

private_information: I am allowed to move disks I J K L M N O
Disk labels A through O exist where A is the smallest and O is the largest
Initial stack on left peg from top to bottom is A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O
agent_2.goal: Achieve the specified goal configuration using legal Tower of Hanoi moves while only moving disks I J K L M N O

private_information: I coordinate agent_1 and agent_2 to produce a single valid plan
I must produce a PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownward solver
I must keep agent actions distinct and respect agent disk move restrictions
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' proposed primitive moves and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that reaches the goal configuration

public_information: Classic Tower of Hanoi with three pegs labeled left middle right
Legal move: move the top disk of any peg to another peg if the moved disk is smaller than the destination peg top disk or the destination peg is empty
Only one disk moves at a time
Agents have disjoint move permissions: agent_1 may move A B C D E F G H and agent_2 may move I J K L M N O
Initial configuration: left peg has top-to-bottom A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O; middle peg empty; right peg empty
Goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom E F G H I J K L M N O, middle peg top-to-bottom C, right peg top-to-bottom A B D

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You may only move disks A B C D E F G H. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you can perform from the known initial configuration toward achieving the goal configuration. Each primitive move must be formatted exactly as: agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ. All moves must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and you must not move disks outside your permission set. Do not emit PDDL.

You are agent_2. You may only move disks I J K L M N O. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you can perform from the known initial configuration toward achieving the goal configuration. Each primitive move must be formatted exactly as: agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ. All moves must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and you must not move disks outside your permission set. Do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your job is to integrate the primitive move sequences produced by agent_1 and agent_2 and to produce a single PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeted for the FastDownward solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct by naming move actions with the agent prefix, for example move-agent_1 and move-agent_2, and ensure the domain models disk sizes and legal stacking constraints. Use the provided public information and the agents' private information as the only facts about the initial and allowed moves. Resolve any ordering conflicts while preserving legality and agent restrictions. Output only the PDDL domain and PDDL problem enclosed in the required tags.
